SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui

Class MyShelfieApplication

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.MyShelfieApplication
Direct Known Subclasses:
BoardView, ChatPage, ConnectionPage, GameInterface, GUILauncher, LoginPage, MainInterface
public abstract class MyShelfieApplication extends javafx.application.Application
The GameEngine class represents the engine for a multiplayer game. It handles game logic, player interactions, and user interface rendering.

This class provides methods for managing the game flow, handling player actions, and displaying game screens. It also manages the waiting and winning pages to provide a seamless user experience.

The GameEngine class serves as the core component of the game system, coordinating different game elements and ensuring smooth gameplay.

Usage example:


 GameEngine engine = new GameEngine();
 engine.startGame();
Since:
2023-06-28
Version:
1.0

    • getFXMLFile

      @NotNull @Contract(pure=true) public static String getFXMLFile(String fileName)
      Given a "fxml" file name that contains a layout for a page of the game, this method retrieves the complete file-path to the layout file
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the layout
      Returns:
      the complete file-path to a file containing a layout page structure

    • setupScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene setupScene(String FXMLFileName)

      Set up a scene with no preferred width or height

      The automatic size of the scene will be set to fit up the content

      Parameters:
      FXMLFileName - the layout file reference
      Returns:
      the scene personalized as described

    • setupScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene setupScene(String FXMLFileName, double percentWidth, double percentHeight)

      Construct a scene from a specific file containing a static layout (.fxml)

      More precisely the scene retrieved by this method will have height and width based on screen size and a percent passed as parameter

      Parameters:
      FXMLFileName - the layout file reference
      percentWidth - the percent width of the scene based on screen size
      percentHeight - the percent height of the scene based on screen size
      Returns:
      the scene personalized as described

    • setupScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene setupScene(String FXMLFileName, double percentWidth, double percentHeight, javafx.scene.layout.Pane rootPaneContainer)

      Construct a scene from a specific file containing a static layout (.fxml)

      Parameters:
      FXMLFileName - the layout file reference
      percentWidth - the percent width of the scene based on screen size
      percentHeight - the percent height of the scene based on screen size
      rootPaneContainer - the main pane container for every graphical component in the layout file
      Returns:
      the scene personalized as described

    • setupSceneWithPane

      public javafx.scene.Scene setupSceneWithPane(String FXMLFileName)
      Sets up a JavaFX scene with a pane as the root container, using the specified FXML file. The scene will have no preferred width or height, and the automatic size will be set to fit the content.
      Parameters:
      FXMLFileName - the name of the FXML file containing the layout
      Returns:
      the JavaFX scene with the specified FXML layout and a pane as the root container

    • setupSceneWithPane

      public javafx.scene.Scene setupSceneWithPane(String FXMLFileName, double percentWidth, double percentHeight)
      Sets up a JavaFX scene with a pane as the root container, using the specified FXML file. The scene will have a preferred width and height based on the screen size and the specified percentages.
      Parameters:
      FXMLFileName - the name of the FXML file containing the layout
      percentWidth - the percentage of the screen width to set as the preferred width of the scene
      percentHeight - the percentage of the screen height to set as the preferred height of the scene
      Returns:
      the JavaFX scene with the specified FXML layout and a pane as the root container, with the preferred size set

    • setupMaximizedScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene setupMaximizedScene(String FXMLFileName)
      Sets up a JavaFX scene with the specified FXML file and maximizes it to fill the entire screen.
      Parameters:
      FXMLFileName - the name of the FXML file containing the layout
      Returns:
      the JavaFX scene with the specified FXML layout, maximized to fill the entire screen

    • setScene

      private javafx.scene.Scene setScene(String FXMLFileName)

      Sets up a JavaFX scene using the specified FXML file, with no preferred width or height.

      The automatic size of the scene will be set to fit up the content

      Parameters:
      FXMLFileName - the name of the FXML file containing the layout
      Returns:
      the JavaFX scene with the specified FXML layout

    • setScene

      private javafx.scene.Scene setScene(String FXMLFileName, double percentWidth, double percentHeight)
      Sets up a JavaFX scene using the specified FXML file, with a preferred width and height based on the screen size and the specified percentages.
      Parameters:
      FXMLFileName - the name of the FXML file containing the layout
      percentWidth - the percentage of the screen width to set as the preferred width of the scene
      percentHeight - the percentage of the screen height to set as the preferred height of the scene
      Returns:
      the JavaFX scene with the specified FXML layout and the preferred width and height set

    • setScene

      private javafx.scene.Scene setScene(String FXMLFileName, double percentWidth, double percentHeight, javafx.scene.layout.Pane rootPaneContainer)
      Sets up a JavaFX scene using the specified FXML file, with optional customizations for the preferred width, height, and root pane container.
      Parameters:
      FXMLFileName - the name of the FXML file containing the layout
      percentWidth - the percentage of the screen width to set as the preferred width of the scene (0.0 to 100.0)
      percentHeight - the percentage of the screen height to set as the preferred height of the scene (0.0 to 100.0)
      rootPaneContainer - the pane container to use as the root pane, or null if the root pane should be loaded from the FXML file
      Returns:
      the JavaFX scene with the specified FXML layout and customizations applied

    • setStage

      private void setStage(javafx.stage.Stage stage, boolean fullScreen, boolean maximized)
      Configures the specified stage with the specified display mode (fullscreen or maximized).
      Parameters:
      stage - the JavaFX stage to configure
      fullScreen - true to set the stage to fullscreen mode, false otherwise
      maximized - true to set the stage to maximized mode, false otherwise

      Parameters:
      FXMLFileName - the name of the FXML file containing the layout for the new scene

      Sets up the JavaFX controller for the application. If the controller is null, an error in loading the game is displayed.
      Parameters:
      fxController - the JavaFX controller to be set

    • errorInLoadingMyShelfieGame

      public void errorInLoadingMyShelfieGame(String text)
      Displays an error alert indicating a loading error in the My Shelfie game. The application will be terminated after displaying the alert.

    • errorInLoadingMyShelfieGame

      public void errorInLoadingMyShelfieGame(String contentText, String headerText)
      Displays an error alert with the specified content and header text. The application will be terminated after displaying the alert.
      Parameters:
      contentText - the content text of the error alert
      headerText - the header text of the error alert

    • closeWindowEvent

      private void closeWindowEvent(javafx.stage.WindowEvent event)
      Handles the close window event of the application. Exits the application by calling Platform.exit() and System.exit().
      Parameters:
      event - the window event triggering the close event

    • closeWindowEvent

      private void closeWindowEvent(javafx.stage.WindowEvent event, int exitCode)
      Handles the close window event of the application. Exits the application by calling Platform.exit() and System.exit(). This method is overloaded to allow specifying an exit code.
      Parameters:
      event - the window event triggering the close event
      exitCode - the exit code to be passed to System.exit()

    • setPreserveRatio

      private void setPreserveRatio()
      Sets up the stage to preserve its ratio when resized. This includes setting up a window size change listener.

    • showWaitingView

      protected void showWaitingView(String waitingText)
      Shows the waiting view with the specified waiting text.
      Parameters:
      waitingText - the text to be displayed in the waiting view

    • hideWaitingView

      protected void hideWaitingView()
      Hides the waiting view.

    • isInWaiting

      public boolean isInWaiting()
      Checks if a waiting page is currently displayed.
      Returns:
      true if a waiting page is displayed, false otherwise.

    • showWinningPage

      public void showWinningPage(String winner, Map<String,Integer> pointPlayerDisplay, boolean isThisPlayer)
      Displays the winning page with the specified information.
      Parameters:
      winner - the name of the winner, or null if the game is over without a winner.
      pointPlayerDisplay - a map containing the points for each player.
      isThisPlayer - a boolean indicating whether the current player is the winner.

    • onCloseWindowEventAction

      protected void onCloseWindowEventAction(javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.stage.WindowEvent> newOnCloseEventHandler)

    • hideWinningView

      protected void hideWinningView()
      Hides the winning view by hiding the winning page and setting it to null.
